citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On February 6, 2024, an anesthesia record for a study procedure of female pig (ID Number 95149) documented a rectal
temperature of 36.2 degrees Celsius at 9:25 am. The subsequent record of rectal temperature was 37.2 degrees Celsius
at 12:20 PM.
According to the IACUC approved protocol, body temperature is to be maintained between 38 and 40 degrees Celsius
and measured every 15 minutes during anesthesia for study procedures. Two additional randomly selected surgery
records from this protocol did not include temperature documentation every 15 minutes.
Not having maintained an animal’s temperature within protocol parameters and documenting temperature in intervals
longer than 15 minutes constitutes a significant change to the IACUC approved protocol. Changes in animal use activities,
prior to review and approval by the IACUC, can be detrimental to animal health.
The IACUC must review and approve proposed significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing
activities.
To be corrected by this day forward: July 23, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
